alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Scott County; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 1:58PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Logan, northwestern Scott and northwestern Polk Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morgan Springs, or 14 miles west of Waldron, moving northeast at 55mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mansfield... Beauchamp... Oliver... Echo... Morgan Springs... Queen Wilhelmina State Park... Bates... Barber... Black Fork... Cauthron... Black Fork Mountain Wilderness... Winfield... Hon... Lucas... Liberty... Ione... Elm Park... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for western Arkansas.
